H0.text: Tidal forces had the greatest impact on the current shape of Nevada's basin and range landscape.

H1.text: Wind erosion had the greatest impact on the current shape of Nevada's basin and range landscape.

H2.text: Plate tectonics had the greatest impact on the current shape of Nevada's basin and range landscape.

H3.text: Global warming had the greatest impact on the current shape of Nevada's basin and range landscape.

A4.text: It is generally accepted that basin and range topography is the result of extension and thinning of the lithosphere, which is composed of crust and upper mantle.

A5.text: The most accepted hypothesis suggests that crustal shearing associated with the San Andreas Fault caused spontaneous extensional faulting similar to that seen in the Great Basin.
